summary: On January 13, 2012, the Costa Concordia cruise ship hit a rock near Isola del Giglio, Italy, while trying to sail close to the island. The ship sank, and 32 people died. The captain, Francesco Schettino, was found guilty of manslaughter and sent to prison. The ship was fixed and moved to Genoa for scrapping. The whole process cost about $2 billion. title: Costa Concordia disaster
